title.rendered: 5 Most Common Pain Points in Any Home

content.rendered:
If you are a homeowner, it’s a good idea to get your entire home professionally inspected every year. This allows you to catch problems before they get worse and turn into expensive repairs.

In this post, you will learn about the most common issues that often affect a home and how regular inspection can help you save money.

Cooling and Heating Systems

No matter how expensive your HVAC system is, it won’t last forever. Your air conditioning unit and furnace need to be well-maintained so they can keep working at their peak efficiency.

You should get your furnace serviced every year before the winter begins, especially if your furnace is more than 3 years old. The same goes for an AC unit – get it serviced every year before summer starts.

Remember, servicing your HVAC unit includes cleaning out the air ducts and vents, which is crucial to maintain and improve the quality of your home’s indoor air. Over time, air ducts accumulate a lot of dirt, dust, pollen, mold, and other contaminants. You don’t want to be breathing in pollutant-filled air every single day.

Poor Plumbing

Plumbing issues are one of the hardest to detect on your own mostly because pipes are usually located in hidden and hard-to-reach places. If your house is more than 10 years old, you should pay special attention to your plumbing.

A professional knows how to check for leaky and loose pipes that can damage the roofing and walls. It is crucial that plumbing problems are caught early, or they can wreak havoc on your house’s foundation.

Problematic Ventilation

If you live in a humid area or your home doesn’t have proper ventilation, mildew or mold can start to grow inside. It is extremely important that there is enough air flow running through every space in the house, including the attic and garage.

Moisture mostly builds up in the bathroom, so make sure your exhaust fan is working well. If you suspect any mold or fungi growing in your air ducts, vents, bathroom, kitchen, attic, or anywhere, call an air duct cleaning company immediately.

Wonky Electrical Wiring

The #1 problem homeowners face is with their electrical wiring, especially if they live in an area where hurricanes and tropical storms are common.

The most common parts that pose problems include grounded outlets, tube and knob wiring, and ground fault breaker outlets.

Your Roof is in Rough Shape

If your roofing is not in tip-top shape, it can lead to more serious issues. And yet, the majority of homeowners don’t pay attention to their roofing until it reaches a critical stage and starts leaking.

Failure to pay attention to the wear-and-tear of your roof can force you to shell out a small fortune in repairs or replacement in the future.

Take Care of Your Investment With Regular Cleaning and Maintenance

Your house is your most important investment – make sure you take care of it. Yearly maintenance calls to an air duct cleaning or home insulation company will only cost you a couple of hundreds of dollars, but if you wait for something to break or leak, the repairs/replacement can easily run into thousands of dollars.

Hiring a certified and trained inspector will save you time, headache, and a lot of money from having to fix any problems later down the line. Call United Home Services at 800-399-4248 or fill out our online contact form to get in touch with us!
